Class Bee

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bee

  • public class Bee
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance (i.e. object) maintains information about a bee.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bee(java.lang.String n, char g, int y, int m)
      Constructor: an instance with nickname n, gender g, birth year y, and birth month m.
      Bee(java.lang.String n, int y, int m, Bee ma)
      Constructor: a male Bee with nickname n, hatch year y, hatch month m, and mother ma.
      Bee(java.lang.String n, int y, int m, Bee ma, Bee pa)
      Constructor: a female Bee with nickname n, hatch year y, hatch month m, mother ma, and father pa.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDad(Bee e)
      Add e as this Bee's father.
      void addMom(Bee e)
      Add e as this Bee's mother.
      Bee getDad()
      Return this Bee's father (null if unknown)
      Bee getMom()
      Return this Bee's mother (null if unknown)
      int getMonth()
      Return the month this Bee hatched from its egg
      java.lang.String getNickname()
      Return this Bee's nickname
      int getNumChildren()
      Return the number of children of this Bee
      int getYear()
      Return the year this Bee hatched from its egg
      boolean isMale()
      Return the value of "This Bee is male.”
      boolean isSibling(Bee e)
      Return value of "this Bee and e are siblings.” (note: if e is null they can't be siblings, so false should be returned).
      boolean isYounger(Bee e)
      Return value of "this Bee is younger than e." (note: same month and same year does not mean younger) Precondition: e is not null.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bee

        public Bee(java.lang.String n,
   char g,
   int y,
   int m)
        Constructor: an instance with nickname n, gender g, birth year y, and birth month m. Its parents are unknown, and it has no children. Precondition: n has at least 1 character, y >= 2000, m is in 1..12, and g is 'M' for male or 'F' for female.

      • Bee

        public Bee(java.lang.String n,
   int y,
   int m,
   Bee ma)
        Constructor: a male Bee with nickname n, hatch year y, hatch month m, and mother ma. Precondition: n has at least 1 character, y >= 2000, m is in 1..12, and ma is a female.

      • Bee

        public Bee(java.lang.String n,
   int y,
   int m,
   Bee ma,
   Bee pa)
        Constructor: a female Bee with nickname n, hatch year y, hatch month m, mother ma, and father pa. Precondition: n has at least 1 character, y >= 2000, m is in 1..12, ma is a female, and pa is a male.

    • Method Detail

      • getNickname

        public java.lang.String getNickname()
        Return this Bee's nickname

      • getYear

        public int getYear()
        Return the year this Bee hatched from its egg

      • getMonth

        public int getMonth()
        Return the month this Bee hatched from its egg

      • isMale

        public boolean isMale()
        Return the value of "This Bee is male.”

      • getMom

        public Bee getMom()
        Return this Bee's mother (null if unknown)

      • getDad

        public Bee getDad()
        Return this Bee's father (null if unknown)

      • getNumChildren

        public int getNumChildren()
        Return the number of children of this Bee

      • addMom

        public void addMom(Bee e)
        Add e as this Bee's mother. Precondition: this Bee’s mother is unknown and e is female.

      • addDad

        public void addDad(Bee e)
        Add e as this Bee's father. Precondition: This Bee's father is unknown, this Bee is female, and e is male.

      • isYounger

        public boolean isYounger(Bee e)
        Return value of "this Bee is younger than e." (note: same month and same year does not mean younger) Precondition: e is not null.

      • isSibling

        public boolean isSibling(Bee e)
        Return value of "this Bee and e are siblings.” (note: if e is null they can't be siblings, so false should be returned).
